topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d33c3863687207013b0000#post_53d33c3863687207013b0000
Theoretically conquering the entire world is possible, but the reason why no one has succeeded in doing it lately is that everyone the last two thousand years to try it were dumbasses that didn't understand over-extending your military forces is a bad idea.

In order for nowadays for a country to actually conquer the entire world it would take about a hundred years to do so due to constraints due to economic conditions as well as political conditions.  To try to conquer the world faster than that would be stupid.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d33d2863687217d0580000#post_53d33d2863687217d0580000

Part of the blame also comes from the fact that with technology increasing, people expect things to be instantaneous and grow more impatient. They want things at the moment and they don't care about accomplishing something in the long run.


"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d33cf3636872389c500100#post_53d33cf3636872389c500100

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d344ca63687246dcbb0100#post_53d344ca63687246dcbb0100
There's a difference between taking notes off something and religiously zealot towards it.  What I mean by this is that taking notes on what socrates said is good, but thinking he's the end all be all answer to everything is a quick way to wind up fucking up badly.
